inn1.comm: movement straight away, started full on middle and moved away from Smith but he met it with a solid forward defensive
hint of width outside off, Smith drives it square but straight to backward point
gets squared up by this one as he walks across the crease and aims to play to the leg side then gets a leading edge back down the pitch...walked so far across you could see leg stump
beaten! Well bowled. Full outside off, draws Smith into the drive without much footwork and the ball flies past the outside edge
full on middle and leg, squeezed out towards square leg to get South Africa on their way
full outside off, hint of away movement to the right hander but it's punched firmly to mid-on...good opening over from Anderson
starts outside off stump on a full length, Smith comes forward, almost on the walk, and defends to the off side
dragged down short and wide, Smith reaches out for a cut shot and gets it down to third man off the bottom half of the bat
well bowled, jags back into Amla from short of a length and takes him in the stomach...extra bounce for Finn
comes right across the crease outside off and defends quite a wide delivery into the covers...all his stumps were exposed
more seam movement from short of a length, nips back and cramps him for room
full outside off, Amla hanging back a touch but is still able to drive this firmly between mid-off and cover
driven straight to Patel at mid-off and they set off for a single...Patel is unable to gather it cleanly and Amal would have been struggling with a better piece of fielding
beaten! Another one past the edge. On a good length going across Smith and he pushes forward but the ball is too good
goes across the crease outside off then tucks this delivery through the leg side giving work for long leg who is quite square
whipped again, from off stump, timed sweetly but he picks out midwicket where Ian Bell fields well
outside off, going across the left hander, and it's left alone
taken from outside off again into the leg side, flicked down to long leg to keep the strike
short of a length, Smith aims to play to the leg side but doesn't make contact and gets taken high on the pad
again Smith misses out as he aims to leg, short of a length ball and takes him on the pad
adjusts the line a touch to outside off, Smith defends towards the on side
that's a good one...jags away late from Smith from back of a length and Smith followed it, pushing away from his body and is annoyed with himself
strangled appeal for lbw as Smith gets squared up on the back foot aiming to leg and is beaten by the seam movement...was easily missing off stump
touch shorter this time, Smith gets behind the line and tucks it backward of square on the leg side
beaten! That's a beauty from Anderson as another flies past Smith's edge. Started on off stump and went with the angle and a touch of seam movement. Lovely bowling
forces himself across the crease to a fuller delivery and drives into the covers
goes to his favourites leg-side again, taken from outside off with the strong bottom hand wide of midwicket
on a full length at off stump, Smith tucks it straight to midwicket
worked down towards mid-on where Smith picks his fielder as it's Patel and comfortably makes the single
full outside off, Amla drives without much footwork straight to cover...just Amla's seventh ball of the innings
back of a length outside off, Smith defends to the covers
few players would have hit this delivery straight, but Smith takes a full and wide delivery straight of mid-off with a closed face and times it very well
straightens the line a touch, full outside off, this time Smith works it towards mid-on
full on middle and off, flicked to midwicket and Finn his kicked the stumps although not called dead ball this time
dragged down short, Smith goes for the pull but is early on the short and gets the ball bobbles back towards the keeper
full outside off, driven on the up straight to mid-off
aggression from Amla as he walks across the crease and takes this from well outside off stump with a strong flick but picks out midwicket
drives into the off side this time against a full ball on off stump, goes to mid-off
flamboyant drive, on the up to a ball that wasn't a half volley but, again, he finds the fielder this time at cover
stroke of luck for Amla as he drives and gets a thick inside edge past the stumps which then beats long leg
behind the line on off stump and defended back to the bowler
super shot, again he steps across the crease and then lofts this over midwicket from wide outside off stump and despite a fairly slow outfield it reaches the rope. Anderson is not amused.
beats the edge again, good length outside off stump and goes across the left hander
driven on the up and it goes in the air towards mid-off but drops short of the fielder
dropped in a little shorter, Smith tries to pull but doesn't time his shot and gets a thick bottom edge into his pads
that's typical Smith...a full ball on off stump and he clips it along the ground between midwicket and mid-on. That will relieve some of his frustration
short of a length outside off stump, Smith moves across and tucks it behind square then makes it into a second run which does not impress Alastair Cook or the bowler...Tim Bresnan the man at long leg
freebie for Smith, low full toss on off stump and he eases this wide of mid-on with a bottom-hand whip
on off stump, Amla waits then opens the face to guide the ball to third man

edged! And it goes where second slip had been standing. Was short of a length and Smith pushes at it and that would have been gobbled by second slip (although maybe not given England's catching form this summer)
a touch fuller outside off, left alone
down the pitch by Smith and drives it hard into the square then the ball bounces over backward point
back to working the leg side, taken from outside off through square leg to the man on the boundary
another edge through the slip cordon...Amla forcing off the back foot to a short-of-a-length ball and it flies down to third man. May have been wide of second slip this time if he'd been stood there
full outside off, driven to mid-on
not quite as full this time, Smith watches it like a hawk as he defends to the on side
driven again from outside off with the closed face that sends it to mid-on
very full, on the popping crease, Smith forces it out square on the off side
shorter this time, gives Smith time to open the face and guide it wide of second slip
right across the crease to expose all the stumps then works this from well outside off into midwicket
full on off stump, driven very sweetly straight to mid-off
another inside edge from Amla, tries to force it square through the off side and the ball squirts to square leg
back of a length outside off and Smith shovels it through midwicket
short ball, Amla goes for the pull and is a fraction early on the shot but the ball runs safely down to long leg
outside off, Smith opens the face and sends it through gully down to third man
dragged down short again, Amla nails his pull this time and the ball rockets straight to deep square-leg
immediately Amla is working to the leg side from a delivery outside off
paddle sweep from off stump sends it through short fine-leg but deep square is able to get around
full at middle and leg, takes the pad back down the pitch
worked off the stumps to the leg side
very full and swept firmly out to deep backward square
nice footwork from Amla as he comes down the pitch outside off then works down to long-on
round the wicket, Amla down the pitch and opens the off side then drives very sweetly towards cover who gets one hand on it as he dives
opens the face and drives to extra cover
fired in full at middle and leg, picks out Bopara again at cover
tossed up slower and wide outside off, Amla plays a powerful cover drive and picks the gap this time with the force to beat the sweeper
beauty! That's gripped and turned. Started on middle and spun past Amla's edge while also missing off stump
strangled appeal for lbw as Amla advances down the pitch...nowhere near being given
round the wicket, on off stump, defended to the leg side
work from off stump into the gap at midwicket
full outside off, turned away in front of square to the man patrolling the square boundary
uses his feet then tucks this off the stumps square through the leg side
flicked firmly back at Swann who can't quite stop it in his follow through so Amla steals a single
on middle and leg, worked to short fine-leg who can't stop the single
over the wicket, outside off and flicked to midwicket
fuller and flatter at off stump, driven back to the bowler
brings out the reverse sweep, doesn't middle the ball and a top edge flies over short third man
beaten by the spin, Smith aimed to work to leg and the ball goes past the inside edge which Kieswetter then doesn't take cleanly
goes for a powerful sweep from outside off, doesn't make clean contact then almost tumbles over in the crease
back in the crease this time, tucked from around off stump out to deep square
tossed up on the stumps and driven to long-on
flighted, outside the line of off, steps across and clips through square leg
tossed up outside off, leans out and defends
looping full toss outside the line of off, skips forward and chops down the ground to long-on
on off stump, whipped through midwicket for one
tossed up outside off, opens the face and punches square
floated up outside off stump, comes down the track and pushes to long-off
round the wicket, turns in past Smith's bat as he advances, hitting him on the front pad
works this one off the pads through backward square leg
flighted on off, holding its line, punched into the ground and fielded at extra-cover
looped outside off, mistimed drive from Amla, who manages to scoop the ball over extra-cover this time, despite a few gasps
on the stumps, turned round the corner to fine leg
back of a length and angled across, blocked towards point
dug in short, Smith pulls this from outside off through the on side to the deep midwicket fielder
back of a length, wide of the stump, Amla cuts but can't get it through the infield
another short ball, coming in towards off, opens the face and glides the ball delicately to third man, they push hard for two
length ball on off, shuffles across and drops short of midwicket for one
length ball outside off, steers this to third man - and that's fifty for Smith
round the wicket, closes the face and tucks through backward square leg
tossed up outside off, worked through midwicket
floated up and  worked to the man at midwicket
steps back, exposing all three stumps, but connects with a hard cut shot that flies straight to cover
flighted on the stumps, flicked round the corner slightly awkwardly for a single to long leg
pushed through, not much turn and Amla is hit on the front pad coming down the wicket
angled across and defended on a length outside off

swings across the line, top-edged ... and gone! Bresnan has broken through, banging it in short as Smith skipped down the pitch, he tried to hook but the ball ballooned high into the air, over the wicketkeeper, with Kieswetter running back to settle underneath and take a safe catch
length ball outside off, dabbed towards third man
outside the line of leg stump, nudges off the hips
length ball outside off, played late, it comes off the outside edge but was well controlled, the ball skiddaddling low to third man
on the stumps and worked to midwicket
round the wicket to Duminy, full and on the stumps, paddled fine
short of a length outside off, Amla rocks back but mistimes a hack and the ball goes to mid-on
lovely delivery from Patel, full and inviting, gripping and turning away at Amla drives and misses ... might have been a thin edge too, but Kieswetter didn't cling on
tossed up and Amla lofts this over midwicket, it goes high but not that far and they pick up two
length ball, straightening and this stops in the pitch a touch, Amla is early on the shot and it loops tantalisingly in front of Cook at point
flighted outside the line of off and spinning in, turned into covers
good length ball in the corridor outside off, opens the face and steers one to third man - that's ton up for South Africa
angled across on a length and chopped into the off side
touch shorter, wide of the stumps, cuts the ball into the ground on the off side
another wide bumper, Duminy slashes hard and Morgan tumbles forward to stop the ball on the bounce at point
pitched up a bit more on the stumps and solidly blocked
length ball, on middle and leg, turned in front of square on the leg side
flighted outside off and spinning in, pushed to cover
gives this some air, Duminy tries to sweep outside off, the ball stays low ... and beats Kieswetter too
tossed up and tapped into the off side
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and drives to long-off
floated up outside off, Duminy reverses his hands and sweeps hard straight at third man
tossed up on off, blocked

pitched up and thumping into Duminy's front leg ... did it pitch in line? Anderson is very interested and England ask to review Simon Taufel's not-out decision. Duminy played across the line but the delivery pitched a ball's width outside the line of leg stump, so England lose their review
on the line of off, worked through the leg side
good length, again on the leg stump, deflects off the pad for a hard-run couple through backward square
length ball outside off, gets forward and mistimes a drive down the pitch, Anderson fields
overpitched wide of off and crisply driven through cover, Samit Patel gives chase in the outfield but he wouldn't have caught that even if it were a bacon roll
on the stumps, pushed defensively into the on side
flighted outside off, skips out and drives to long-off
round the wicket to Duminy, sweeps a full ball from outside off to Cook at short fine leg
length ball, spinning in, punches to long-on off the back foot
tossed up wide of the stumps, Amla swings and misses and this time it nestles in Kieswetter's gloves - but no edge
turned off the pads through square leg, that's another half-century for Amla on this productive tour
full and outside the line of off, Duminy tries to reverse sweep and manages to get the ball very fine past Kieswetter, though it doesn't have the pace to get to the rope
tossed up on off and pushed back to the bowler
flighted, straightening on off stump, defended coming forward
goes back and flicks through backward square as Swann's line slides towards leg stump
pushed through outside the line of off, Amla walks across and taps to square leg in his compulsive style
short and a bit of width outside off, slapped through point

Amla calls for one but it isn't there and Duminy is run out! It was clipped through the leg side from outside off, Amla thought it had beaten midwicket and set off only for Anderson to reel the ball in and hurl it to Kieswetter, Duminy wasn't even in the picture, though he is sacrificed in favour of the senior man
good length delivery outside off, punched through the infield to the deep cover sweeper
pitched up on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
angled across and tapped into the off side
drifts on to the left-hander's pads and he clips this calmly through square leg to get off the mark
touch short of a length, outside off and played late towards third man
angled across and played on the back foot
tossed up outside off and played back to the bowler
full and and punched back down the pitch, Swann gets his hands to it but the ball dribbles through and they steal one as long-off comes in
round the wicket, sliding in towards off stump, prodded into the off side
length ball, going on with the arm, driven towards extra-cover
bit more air, outside off stump, driven to long-off
flighted outside off, Amla walks across, goes down on one knee and paddles past the diving Kieswetter for a couple to fine leg
on the stumps, worked towards midwicket
pitched up a bit more on leg stump, flicked round the corner
back of a length delivery in the channel outside off, dabbed towards third man
full and angled across, gets forward and punches to mid-off
length ball, sliding from leg to off, played on the back foot short of gully and Kieswetter tidies up
dug in short, at the man and Elgar swivels to pat the ball to fine leg, bit of bottom edge but enough for his first boundary
tossed up outside off and Amla slog-sweeps over square leg, beating the deep midwicket fielder coming round
on the stumps, worked to midwicket
tossed up and spinning in, Amla advances and doesn't connect cleanly with an on drive, the ball squirting in the air a few feet wide of the diving Morgan at midwicket
flighted outside the line of off, pushed into the covers
on middle stump, plays round the front pad through midwikcet
turns off the pads to short fine leg and they risk another to the fielder, Amla is struggling at the non-striker's end this time but the throw needed to hit and didn't
full outside off, Amla drives with hard hands and edges fine of third man who manages to scoot around the boundary to pull off a good save
worked through midwicket
outside off, chopped backward of square on the off side
worked to midwicket...Elgar struggling to get going
punched to middle from the front foot
full on middle, good over from Bopara as Elgar can only drive this back to him
worked down the ground to long-off
uses his feet and lofts this down the ground, he doesn't time it cleanly but there is enough on it to clear mid-on then it plugs in the outfield
opens the face and drives past a diving cover to long-off
dragged down a touch short and worked with the spin through midwicket
stays in the crease and waits a fraction longer then opens the face to find a gap through point
nicely driven through the off side, he open the face expertly to find the gap but deep cover does well to cut off the boundary
another missed run out?! Was driven firmly towards mid-off and Elgar was the one struggling. A decent throw to the keeper (or a direct hit) and he was short
full on middle, flicked nicely through midwicket wide of the man in the deep
not as full and outside off, Elgar opens the face to backward point
comes onto the front foot this time and pushes firmly through the covers to the sweeper
lovely shot, it was a half-volley and he leaned into the cover drive with a forceful punch that beats the diving cover and the man on the rope
more deft place from Amla as he opens the face and sends this wide of third man who has to use his boot to cut it off...South Africa just starting to go through the gears again
round the wicket, worked off middle stump through midwicket
on middle with just a hint of spin, driven to cover
outside off, uses his wrists and guides it to short third man but can't find the gap
angled towards middle and leg, worked straight to midwicket as the pressure builds on Elgar
gone! Lovely bowling. Tossed up slower by Swann, it gripped off the surface and spun past the outside edge to take middle stump
gets a leading edge first ball as he aims to play to leg and the ball rolls square into the off side
width offered outside off but de Villiers can't beat cover as he drives on the up

technically a drop by Kieswetter as de Villiers gets a thick edge trying to guide to third man...he was at full-stretch to his right and it would have been a superb take. He's held a few like that this season
play into the off side
short of a length, punched off the back foot straight to cover
driven on the up but finds the man at mid-off
picks out the fielder again as he drives...good over from Bresnan
lovely shot, whipped wide of mid-on from outside off with a nice piece of timing and placement
full outside off, Amla opens the face and picks out point
well bowled...that was a cracking delivery, full just outside off and it moved away late to beat Amla's drive
goes across the crease and almost gets a leading edge towards mid-off...sets off quickly for the single and despite a direct hit he is safe
top shot...de Villiers at his best as he brings out an elegant on-drive which just misses the non-striker's stumps and speeds away
now he walks around the crease, goes outside off and turns this wide of mid-on...once again the timing is excellent but Trott manages to haul it back.
round the wicket, full on middle, defended to the leg side
angled into de Villiers who whips it away square into the leg side off the back foot
big hit from Amla...comes down the pitch and picks it up over midwicket with a clean swing of the bat
uses his feet again, this time whips it along the ground towards mid-on
pushes this one back to the bowler
touch shorter, he rocks onto the back foot and drives out to the cover sweeper
starting to open his shoulders, pulls this off a good length in front of square
fuller on middle and off, just enough movement to straighten on Amla as he drives towards mid-off
angled in towards middle and leg, played into the on side just to the right of midwicket...his placement has, generally, been very good this innings
down the track outside leg stump, Finn might have seen him coming and dropped it shorter but de Villiers responded by slapping it over cover although it wasn't quite perfectly timed
pushed towards leg stump, Amla aims to work it away but doesn't make contact and it rolls off the pad
full outside off, touch of movement into de Villiers as he drives to mid-on
that's a good way to greet a new spell...was nowhere near a full delivery but Amla drove on the up high over mid-off
down the leg side and there's an appeal - rather half-hearted - for a catch but the umpire isn't interested
back outside off stump, driven firmly to cover
driven firmly with Amla's punchy style to mid-off who is deep enough to allow a single
walking around the crease again, ends up outside off and pulls a shortish delivery out of the middle but straight at midwicket
now carves this from outside off into the covers but doesn't get the placement right
dropped down the leg side...this one is clearly glanced off the face and Kieswetter went one-handed, low to his left, and couldn't hang on
gives himself a touch of room to drive, it is a short-of-a-length ball and it almost carries to mid-off
goes up and over backward point with an upper cut against a short ball...Bresnan tries to get around but can't stop the boundary
full at middle and off, driven down the ground to mid-on
good yorker, fired in at middle and leg, de Villiers can only just dig it out
angled into de Villiers who works it off the stumps backward of square on the leg side
Tossed up outside off and clipped to mid-on ... and Amla has his ton too, his 10th in ODI cricket
on off stump, goes back and taps to square leg
drags this down short of a length and Amla bunts hard in front of deep midwicket for as graceful a slog as you're likely to see
outside the line of off and pushed through the covers
full and flighted outside off and driven through cover-point
tossed up outside off and this time Amla fails to pierce the infield
tossed up, de Villiers attempts to reverse sweep and the ball loops up, possibly off bat, definitely off shoulder, over his head and Kieswetter takes a comfortable catch - but Taufel shakes his head
on the stumps and worked towards midwicket
shuffles across and turns through the leg side
looped up outside off, mistimed drive and it flies just over Swann's head, arms outstretched
outside off, turns this to short third man
on off stump, steps out and works through square leg, good running gets two
pitched up on middle, dug out toward midwicket
touch short of a length, stays back and works the ball to midwicket again
length delivery on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
full and darting in towards leg stump, glanced square to the fielder in the deep who keeps the damage to one
incredible shot from Amla, moving outside the line of off and steering a length ball through backward square leg with flick of those rubbery wrists
slides down the leg side this time
full length delivery, on the stumps, steps back and lifted over the midwicket area
tossed up outside the line of off and guided to third man
flighted, full and outside off, waits on it and then swats low through square leg
full length, on the stumps, steps away and lofts a drive over the cover region

bowled him! De Villiers advanced as Swann sent down a non-turner, it dipped late on the batsman, who played across the line and the ball skittered through low to thump into the base of off stump. Swann gets his man after an over's reprieve
on off stump, turned round the corner to long leg
tossed up on the stumps, steps out and punches to long-on
poor ball from Anderson, well down the leg side and it only requires a tickle to fine leg - and that shot makes Amla the fastest man ever to 3,000 runs in ODIs
full length and driven firmly back past the bowler this time
length ball in the corridor outside off, swiped through the covers
banged in short and crikey, that's a shot from a new man at the crease, scintillating a pull shot in front of deep midwicket for four
full and wide of off stump, driven hard but can't beat mid-off
drags his length back, more width this time and cut straight to point
flighted outside off and driven to the deep cover fielder
guides this fine to third man
tossed up on the stumps and defended back to the bowler
flighted on the stumps, worked down the ground to long-on
worked off middle through the leg side
tossed up on the stumps, slides through and beats de Plessis' glance to leg
length ball on the stumps, whipped off the pads through backward square
full toss and Amla gives that the treatment, carting the ball out towards the unguarded cow corner

my word, that's a marvellous adjustment from Amla, stepping across outside off, Bresnan bowled it full and wide and Amla rotated his wrists at the last minute to deflect the ball deftly to fine third man
pitched up, a touch full and outside off, worked through square leg for one this time
full length, around the line of off, du Plessis gets out and drives in orthodox fashion to cover
Amla drives a full ball inside out this time, Bopara stops it at cover but they scramble back for a second - good running and a fruitful over for South Africa
short of a length, pulled through the square leg
pitched up outside off, Amla goes miles across and taps through the leg side for another single
dug in short at the batsman, du Plessis tries a cute scoop over fine leg ... but fails to connect
driven off a good length through the covers to the sweeper on the rope
pitched up at the stumps, Amla gives himself room and swats a low drive to mid-off
du Plessis gets a slice of luck, heaving at a good length ball and getting an inside edge fine on the leg side, past Patel on the edge of the circle and it runs away for four
full-length delivery on the stumps, Amla tries to play through the leg side and gets a leading edge towards extra-cover but that's enough for a single and a new ODI best
pitched up and driven down the ground, long-off comes across but they get a couple
slower ball outside off, waits on it and chops a single through point
full, almost a leg-stump half-volley, which Amla punches between deep midwicket and wide long-on
another slower delivery, short of a length, du Plessis flat-bats this down the ground to long-on
pitched up around off, Amla opens up his body and chips over extra-cover for another couple - he's scored runs all round the ground today
back of a length, outside the line of off, again du Plessis tries to scoop it over fine leg and misses out
short delivery, at the man, du Plessis hooks through square leg
pitched up at the blockhole, Amla steps away, opens the face and impudently deflects the ball past backward point for four that takes him to 150
short and slow, Amla backs away and tries to ramp the ball over short third man but it hasn't got enough pace on it and Bresnan pouches. After another everyday display of magnificence, Amla departs
full of a length, outside off, du Plessis swings a crooked bat at it but can't get the ball back past Finn
bouncer, at the man, du Plessis backs away and pulls through mid-on, the fielder has to come in off the rope and they hustle for a second

inn2.comm: good length outside off, left alone by Cook
gone! What a start for South Africa. Tsotsobe produces a superb yorker which spears under Cook's bat and takes out the off stump.
back of a length going across Trott, takes a thick outside edge wide of the slips down to third man but he was fairly well controlled
edge? Glove? What a start from Tsotsobe. This one is short of a length and climbs at Bell, taking the glove but it doesn't carry through to de Villiers
short of a length again, Bell gets across and works into the leg side
angled across outside off and played down to third man
down the leg side, takes the thigh pad through to de Villiers who makes an excellent take diving to his left
full on middle and off, defended back down the pitch
outside off, Trott comes across the crease and defends square on the off side
drifting into the pads, flicked away to long leg
short of a length on off stump, Bell plays at the top of the bounce into the off side
worked off his body by Bell through square leg
outside leg stump and neatly clipped through square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
dropped...that was a sharp bouncer which Bell went to pull and got a top edge that just eluded a leaping de Villiers. Was a tough chance, but he got gloves to it
tucked off the hip down to long leg...Tsotsobe working up a bit of pace
opens the face and guides it through backward point to third man
full on middle and leg, flicked straight to the man at midwicket
dropped in short and picked up over the leg side by Bell as he pulls from outside off stump in front of square...had plenty of time to play that
uses his feet and comes down the pitch, misses his flick and is taken on the pad
defended from off stump towards mid-on
outside off, Trott gets onto the front foot and defends into the off side...McLaren fields in his follow through
touch wider outside off, gives Trott the opportunity to open the face down to third man
pitched a little fuller and straighter, Bell defends
tries to guide down to third man again but gets beaten on the top edge this time...pretty dangerous with the angle doing across him and two slips waiting
this one is shorter so Trott has more time to adjust and this time connects with his glide past the slips
lovely shot, pure timing from Bell as he punches square off the back foot and beats the diving point. Like Amla, very little force in that shot. All touch.
fuller but quite wide outside off, Bell leans back on his drive a touch and picks out cover
straighter over off stump, Bell chops it down towards backward point and du Plessis is rapid in that position
backs away to leg touch which opens up the off side then he cuts it deliberately over cover as Tsotsobe drops short
outside off, Trott leaves it alone
back of a length, Trott gets across and defends to the off side
touch fuller this time, brings Trott forward and he pushes back towards the bowler
brings out the cover drive to a wider delivery, he connected nicely but it went straight to cover
done by the spin! Trott cuts a wide delivery down to third man, it pitches a few metres in front of Amla then spins away from Amla who is left flat on the outfield
that's a trademark Trott shot, a full delivery around off stump whipped wide of mid-on
gets a decent stride forward then defends square into the off side
short of a length on off stump, guided past backward point and this time it's an easy piece of work for third man
it's proving a popular route...another open-face glide that beats backward point
fuller at off stump, Trott comes forward and defends to mid-off
shorter this time, Trott tries to beat backward point with a dab-cut but du Plessis prevents any runs
worked off the stumps to midwicket
starts full on off stump, defended square into the off side
he's already charging Morkel, comes down the track and it's pitched short so Bell pulls but gets it to mid-on
connects cleanly with the pull this time, he stayed in his crease and played it conventionally through square leg with only one man to beat in the deep
short of a length, Bell wants to get at Morkel but defends this delivery
fuller on middle and leg, tries to turn it through the leg side but it goes straighter than he wanted to mid-on
pushed down the leg side so he'll need to bowl that again
back outside off stump, opens the face through backward point and places it wide enough of Amla at third man for a swift couple
starts short of a length at Trott's body, works it neatly between midwicket and mid-on
pushed outside off stump and Trott guides another down to third man
dragged down short, Bell is quickly onto the pull but doesn't middle the shot this time and the ball dribbles out to deep midwicket
a proper bouncer this time, over leg stump, but Trott has plenty of time to duck
another short ball, Trott gets inside the line and pulls down to long leg
another short ball, Bell pulls through square leg quite some distance for the fielder to make up
offered some width and Trott cuts firmly down to third man where Amla gets a cheer each time he fields cleanly...these two batsman have also run well between the wickets
fuller outside off, Trott onto the front foot and with an open face guides the ball to Amla again
uses his feet to Morkel again, comes down on a line outside leg but can only defend this time to the off side
stays in his crease this time and blocks a fuller ball towards mid-on who is now sitting quite deep
back outside off, that's a good line to Trott, defended to mid-off
squared up a touch by a back-of-a-length delivery and it runs to backward point
looped up, plenty of air, on leg stump and defended watchfully
outside the line of off stump, pitched a touch shorter, goes back and chops through the covers for one
speared in towards leg stump, leans forward and clips wide of midwicket
tossed up on middle and off, Bell reverses the bat and paddles a fine sweep past short third man, though Morkel gallops across from the leg side to prevent four
and Trott follows suit, playing a delicate reverse sweep to a full delivery, bit more power to this and again short third man is beaten as the ball gets away to the rope
flighted on off stump, pushed into the off side
Bell stays back and taps a length ball at the stumps into a gap at midwicket
pitched up at the stumps, worked off the pads to the fielder at midwicket
full and angling in towards off stump, played back to the bowler

scooped hiiiiiiiiiiiiiiigh towards long leg ... and Elgar takes a fantastic catch over his shoulder to remove Trott! It looked like he had misjudged it, having come in off the rope, but backpedalled quickly and hurled himself full length to get his hands underneath it. Very composed, ahem, from Elgar
length ball outside the line of off, lets this through
good length ball in the corridor, pushed into the off side on the front foot
full length delivery on the stumps, played back to the bowler
flighted outside off and driven to cover
pushed through a gap on the off side to the man at deep cover
flighted on middle, Bopara plays a little tentatively at it and gets an inside edge towards backward square
tossed up outside the line of off and pushed to cover
works this one down the ground and gives a late call to run, Morkel fields at mid-on but his underarm throw to de Villiers gives Bell time to gain his crease
back of a length delivery, down the leg side, hits the thigh pad and rolls behind square
length ball outside off, Bell opens the face and guides a single to third man
teasing line, slightly back of a length and Bopara hangs his bat out lazily as the ball zips past
tighter line to off stump, gets forward and pushes to cover
pitched up wide of the stumps, gets across and blocks into the off side
shorter length, outside off but not much width, dabbed to cover-point
good length, sliding across the batsman, who steers a single through point
pitched up, too full and a touch wide, driven with a wristy flick through cover
drags his length back, pushed across the right-hander, who opens the face and guides another unfussy single to third man
strays on to the legs, nudged through backward square to rotate the strike again
short and speared across, room for Bell to swing his arms but a cut shot flies on the bounce to point
back of a length again, tries to guide the ball to third man but this bobbles to point
drags this short and wide, Bopara chops through extra-cover off the back foot for a couple
tossed up outside off, gets forward and pushed to cover
full and drifting in towards the stumps, Bopara tries to drive through the off side but gets an inside edge past the stumps to backward square leg
full toss, clubbed through cover to the fielder in the deep and they get back for two

a beauty bowls Bell! Peterson gave it a rip, the ball pitching in line with off and straightening sharply, Bell played inside the line and had his off stump pegged back. It was very similar to the ball from Patel that shaved Amla's off stump ... but a smidge better, obviously
tossed up towards off stump, gets forward and punches to mid-off
length ball pushed across the batsman, blocked into the off side
full and wide and Bopara clatters this through backward point for a confidence-boosting four
pitched up on leg stump this time and clipped through square leg for a single
stays back and defends a length ball into the leg side
short of a length, opens the face and gets and edge through gully for one
bangs this in short but it doesn't get up all that much and Bopara pulls sweetly through backward square leg
tossed up outside off and spinning in, defended with bat and pad into the on side
flighted into the channel, Morgan reverse sweeps for a single to short third man
tip and run to mid-on, again they take on Morkel's arm successfully
tossed up on off stump, played back to the bowler
flighted, on the stumps, comes forward and works a single to mid-on

oh, gone! Bopara slaps a rank long hop straight to extra-cover! He'll be joining the queue to kick himself after that dismissal, having apparently played himself in only to thump a loose delivery down the throat of Faf du Plessis
round the wicket, slip in place and Peterson turns this a good way past Morgan's outside edge as he pushes forward
pitched up on off, bobbles into the leg side via bat and pad
tossed up on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
width outside off and Morgan hops back in his crease to cut through point
on the stumps, blocked into the off side
tossed up outside off, drifting across and worked wide of mid-on for Kieswetter's first run
tossed up on off stump, tapped down the ground to long-off
flighted on the stumps, skips forward and pushes to mid-on
gives this a bit of air, dipping towards middle and off, driven back to the bowler
this grips and spins from around off past leg stump, flicking the pad on its way past de Villiers
flighted on off stump, worked through square leg
dragged a touch short, Morgan hops back and gives himself room but mistimes his cut shot into the ground
pushed through outside off stump, not much turns, Kieswetter goes back and defends
well, well, that's gone a long, long way ... Duminy tossed it up, Kieswetter skipped out and mullered it back over straight long-on
full and spinning in on off, worked for one to midwicket
flighted, straightening on off, chipped back just short of the bowler
tossed up outside off and Morgan crashes a reverse sweep through point for four, that was fiercely struck
lopped up and defended back to the bowler
flighted on the stumps, forward defensive
this one grips and turns past Kieswetter's outside edge as he pushes forward
flighted, drifting in and going on with the arm, edged on to the pad
off-stump line, slightly flatter, steps back and cuts to cover, where a misfield gets them one
tossed up outside off, plays with the spin for a single towards mid-on
flighted on the stumps, straightening a touch and nudged through square leg playing around the front pad
length ball outside the line of off, lets it through
pitched up outside off, in the slot and Kieswetter drives on the up, pinging four through cover
shorter length, good pace and defended into the off side
full, wide of the stumps, Kieswetter has to reach for this but still manages to crunch the ball under the dive of extra-cover for a couple
short of a length, angling in towards the man, flicked insouciantly off the hips through backward square leg
good length, at the top of off stump, blocked towards point
and boy does this spin, cutting back into Morgan and beating de Villiers on its way through
full and Kieswetter tries to work this off the pads only to miss

more turn for Elgar and that's done for Kieswetter, caught at slip via a deflection off AB! Kieswetter tried to close the face to leg, was done by the spin and the ball kissed the back of the bat, de Villiers couldn't take it but Smith was alert as the ball popped up off the keeper's gloves
straightening around the line of off and defended
flighted, on middle and off, turning away and tapped into the off side
tossed up and driven to extra-cover
pitched up, angled across the left-hander, driven through the covers
good length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
angled in on a length, keeps a touch low and Patel chops to midwicket
full and coming in towards the stumps, squirted through backward square leg via an inside edge
length ball, takes the pace off it as Morgan advances, managing to flick the ball behind square on the leg side
good length, coming back in from outside off, driven into the ground back to the bowler
pushed through from round the wicket, blocked back to the bowler
speared across the bows, chopped to point on the back foot
flat and a touch short, hops back and cuts in front of square, extra-cover dives to cut it off but they get one anyway
tossed up on off, punched to mid-off
superbly timed and placed from Patel, going back to whip a length delivery against the spin wide of long-on and away to the rope
bit of width outside off and pushed through the covers
slightly full, outside the line of off, gets forward and squeezes a drive out square but a diving stop at point prevents a run
pitched up and pushed on the front foot towards point
full length and a touch wide, Patel doesn't time his drive to mid-off
goes back and chops a length ball from around off stump to mid-on
shorter length, on the stumps, stays back and turns to midwicket
pitched up outside off and again Patel can't pierce the infield driving - maiden from McLaren
flighted on the stumps, tickled down the ground for one to long-on
dragged short by Elgar but it practically pea-rolls along the ground as Patel swings at it, the ball skidding between de Villiers legs and away for byes
flay delivery, on the stumps, worked to midwicket
drops a touch short and Morgan hops, crouches low and swivel-smashes through backward square to the man on the rope
full and on the stumps, pushed back past the bowler to long-on
looped outside leg stump, tapped through backward square
pitched up outside off, driven wide of mid-off and they take a single
sliding across on a good length, too close to cut but Morgan tries anyway and it beaten past the outside edge
touch short of a length, Morgan leaves his crease and then opens his body, angling to bat to deflect the ball to third man
full and wide, rolls his fingers over the ball to take the pace off but Patel spots it and clumps a bottom-handed drive through extra-cover
full and angling in towards middle, whipped off the pads through midwicket
back of a length, on the stumps, tapped to midwicket on the back foot
pitched up on off and Morgan completely miscues trying to hit through midwicket, the ball flying off the edge near the bottom of the bat but over the head of mid-off running back
on the stumps and turned through the leg side
angled across, defended towards point
length ball, maybe a touch slower, Patel chips this just short of midwicket
pushed across and deflected towards backward point from deep in the crease
pitched up and punched to cover on the front foot
begins with an excellent yorker which shapes into Morgan and he does well to dig it out
on leg stump, Morgan aims to flick it away but doesn't make contact and it takes the pad then dribbles not far from leg stump
full outside off, Morgan tries to drive but doesn't quite get his timing
full on middle and off, Morgan drives down the ground to long-on
good variation from Parnell as he brings out the bouncer to keep Patel alert and he ducks underneath
low full toss to end the over, Patel can't get it away as he bunts it to cover
uses his feet and actually ends up yorking himself and Morgan jabs it down to mid-off
angled down the leg side, Morgan shapes to glance it fine but it comes off the pad down to long leg
back of a length on off stump, defended square of the wicket
coming down the pitch again, the delivery is dropped short and Morgan responds by cutting over backward point
fuller ball shaping into Morgan and it's played to midwicket
short ball outside off, Morgan waits for it and glides down to third man
onto the front foot against a wide delivery, opens the face for another one to third man
short on leg stump, Patel shapes to flick it away to leg but it takes the pad and de Villiers saves with a dive
neatly punched down the ground from a full length on off stump
appeal for lbw as Morgan comes down the pitch and misses his whip across the line...was outside off stump as well as the distance for the ball to travel
clumps a low full toss just wide of midwicket...didn't middle that at all
short ball which Patel pulls but without timing it and in the end it doesn't get further than mid-on
quick and flat to start with, Patel whips it firmly wide of midwicket but straight to the man in the deep
down the pitch and then works it along the ground to long-on
touch short outside off, Patel rocks back in the crease but can only place it out to the cover sweeper

gone! That's the game you'd think. Morgan can't believe it as he pulls a short ball straight to deep midwicket. Not Morgan's most fluent innings by a long way. Good work from AB de Villiers with the field setting
defended off the back foot...the ball didn't really come off the surface
pushed down the ground but can't beat the field
gone...that didn't last long. Bresnan drives at a full ball around off stump and sends a regulation edge to AB de Villiers
beaten! That's a good nut from Parnell who's getting some movement now as this scoots past Swann's outside edge
and another...Swann plays a flat-footed drive outside off and sends another edge to the keeper
back of a length outside off, punched to point on the back foot
full and tailing in towards off stump, driven back to the bowler
pitched up, pitching in line but sliding past leg stump, Anderson is hit on the pad and the ball deflects behind point
length ball, spinning in from outside off, turned into the on side
tossed up and Anderson tries to reverse sweep but makes a bit of a horlicks of it
flighted outside the line of off, spinning in and worked through midwicket for one
skids this through towards middle and leg, Patel goes back and swipes through cover
looped up above the eyeline outside off, Anderson tries to slog across the line and fails to connect
tossed up around off stump, driven to long-on for one
back of a length delivery, coming in towards the batsman, squeezed out to fine leg
pitched up and driven hard square by Patel, down on one knee, but superbly fielded at point by du Plessis
dug in short, flicked round the corner on one leg and they get back for a second
length ball wide of off, cut into the ground on the back foot, point fields
full toss, wide of off, Patel steers this to third man for one
full-pitched delivery in the channel outside off, driven to mid-off
tossed up outside off, Patel slices a drive high over the infield but short of the man at deep cover
over the wicket, spinning in from outside off, Anderson falls over trying to reverse sweep
tossed up outside off and launched high over mid-off, the bottom hand coming off the bat in the process

shambolic running and Anderson goes, run out at the bowler's end after failing to respond to Patel's call. Anderson turned it off his legs, de Villiers gave chase and the No. 10 called "no" with Patel already halfway down. If Anderson had gone to start with, he would have made it but in the end is half a yard short
goes back and slaps a length ball to cover
skips out and chips over the infield on the off side
good length, angling in towards leg stump, clipped through square for one to bring Steven Finn on strike
length ball outside off, steps away and bullets the ball through cover for a freewheeling four
length ball wide of the stumps, stays a bit low and Finn swings and misses
tees off again, a short delivery outside off and this time smacked back down the ground to long-on
four more for Finn! The delivery was full and wide, Finn plays a crunching back-foot drive through extra-cover
yorker in response from Morkel, hits Finn on the pad but it was missing leg
tossed up on middle, Patel gives it the charge and slogs down the ground ... but long-off gets to the ball and they only pick up one
tossed up and turned calmly towards midwicket for a single
Patel advances again and this time lofts the ball all the way over long-off with a mighty swing of the blade
tossed up outside off and scooped over extra-cover, the arms swinging freely for Patel now
nailed over deep midwicket! This is right out the screws, a lot of bottom hand and that's six more - Patel is taking a leaf out of Finn's book
attacks again, not cleanly struck and the ball loops over cover for a couple
pitched up, has a swing and gets a single into the leg side
length ball outside off, steered behind point and du Plessis effects a direct hit but Finn is home
full and wide of off, steps away and thrashes the ball back down the ground to long-off

plays back to a length ball and gone, nicks off! A feisty last-wicket stand is ended by Morkel, bowling a tight line on off, Patel was stuck on the crease and prodded at the ball to be caught at the wicket - which means South Africa win by 80 runs
